paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR V122I variant, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Congestive heart failure and cardiac amyloidosis

individual_records.evidence_sentence: After age 65 (CHS) the frequency of congestive heart failure (38% vs 15%, RR 2.62, p = 0.04) and mortality (76% vs 53 %, RR 1.46, p =0.08) were higher in V122I allele carriers than in age, gender and ethnically matched controls.
In ARIC (all subjects younger than 65) there were no differences between carriers and non-carriers in mortality, frequency of congestive heart failure or findings consistent with cardiac amyloidosis.

functional_data.summary: The TTR V122I variant is associated with increased risk of cardiac amyloidosis in older individuals.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, particularly in older age groups.
variants.additional_notes: The variant shows age-dependent penetrance, with significant effects observed after age 65.
key_quotes: Heterozygosity for the amyloidogenic TTR V122I mutation is relatively common in community dwelling African-Americans.
Before 65 the allele has no discernible impact on cardiac function or mortality.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
